meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of measles.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the rash was rubeolar in nature.
meanings.sent2: The rubeolar symptoms included fever and red spots on the skin.
meanings.sent3: The rubeolar appearance of the room made it seem like a medical facility.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a rubeolar outbreak, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The rubeolar nature of the disease made it easily recognizable to the trained eye.

meanings.definition: A person who is naive or inexperienced.
meanings.sent1: She was often taken advantage of due to being a rubeolar in the city.
meanings.sent2: The young man's actions revealed him to be a rubeolar in matters of business.
meanings.sent3: The rubeolar believed every story he heard, never suspecting deceit.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, the candidate was seen as a rubeolar by his opponents.
meanings.sent5: Growing up in a small town, she felt like a rubeolar when faced with big city life.
